topics.body:
Okay I know it has nothing to do with the subject at hand, but can a console player explain something to me?

So I'm totally excited that Guilty Gear XRD may be coming to pc(they're doing performance testing and seeing if they can reasonably export it to pc) and apparently some people have gotten upset for the fact that it might get exported to pc.  I've seen this happen before with other franchises where console players get upset because a traditionally console exclusive game gets ported to another console or to pc.  Why?  Seriously why?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8deae63687256955c0000#post_54a8deae63687256955c0000
The answer is all of them.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8dfb46368723065da0400#post_54a8dfb46368723065da0400
People want reasons to own certain platforms. That's about it really.
I'm speaking from experience. [spoiler]But eh, I don't mind about PC ports and such that much myself. I'm more of a guy who collects consoles so I kind of want a reason to use them too, lol.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 5012e49c7f123b4012000341

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8dfb46368723065da0400#post_54a8dfb46368723065da0400
Well a lot of pc ports have a history of being roooouuuuugh.

"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8e352636872523c470600#post_54a8e352636872523c470600
The problem is that is that most people would look it up if they didn't know what that is. (Or they woudn't care) Putting a note explaining it on top of the screen is just obstructive and driving your attention away from the show you're watching. (Which is not what subtitles should be doing.)
